metadata.title: USN-6968-2 -- PostgreSQL vulnerability
metadata.description: USN-6968-1 fixed CVE-2024-7348 in PostgreSQL-12, PostgreSQL-14, and PostgreSQL-16  This update provides the corresponding updates for PostgreSQL-9.5 in Ubuntu 16.04 LTS.  Original advisory details:   Noah Misch discovered that PostgreSQL incorrectly handled certain  SQL objects. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute  arbitrary SQL functions as the superuser.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6968-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libecpg-compat3 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8 libecpg-dev - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8 libecpg6 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8 libpgtypes3 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8 libpq-dev - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8 libpq5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8 postgresql-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8 postgresql-client-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8 postgresql-contrib-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8 postgresql-doc-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8 postgresql-plperl-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8 postgresql-plpython-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8 postgresql-plpython3-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8 postgresql-pltcl-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8 postgresql-server-dev-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
